profile.name: Antonio Della Porta
profile.title: Ph.D. Student
profile.specialty: Currently working on Gen AI Agents

paragraphs: I am a PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Salerno, working under the supervision of Prof. Fabio Palomba and Dott. Stefano Lambiase. My research focuses on developing a large variety of LLM-based solutions that can be applied in real world Software Engineering tasks.

My research and development efforts are centered on creating Generative AI-powered agents that serve as versatile, adaptable assistants for software engineers, leveraging open-source technologies to enable transparency and collaborative improvement.
Through my Master's Degree years I also gained experience working with industry partners on technical projects, gathering insights of the real problems software engineers have in practice.

research.title: Generative AI Agents
research.description: Developing autonomous AI systems that can understand complex instructions and execute sophisticated tasks with minimal human supervision.

research.title: Prompt Engineering
research.description: Investigating the science of effectively communicating with large language models to improve their performance, reliability, and alignment with human intent.

research.title: LLMs Integration
research.description: Exploring architectures where multiple LLMs work together as unified systems, combining their strengths to create intelligent and useful solutions.

publications.title: Do Prompt Patterns Affect Code Quality? A First Empirical Assessment of ChatGPT-Generated Code
publications.journal: International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering (EASE), 2025

publications.title: Unlocking Code Simplicity: The Role of Prompt Patterns in Managing LLM Code Complexity
publications.authors: A. Della Porta, G. Recupito, S.Lambiase, D. Di Nucci, F. Palomba
publications.journal: Software Quality Assurance For Artificial Intelligence (SQA4AI), 2025

publications.title: A Novel, Tool-Supported Catalog of Community Smell Symptoms
publications.authors: A. Della Porta, S.Lambiase, G. Catolino, F. Palomba, F. Ferrucci

publications.title: Using large language models to support software engineering documentation in waterfall life cycles: Are we there yet?
publications.authors: A. Della Porta, V. De Martino, G. Recupito, C. Iemmino, G. Catolino, D. Di Nucci, F. Palomba

publications.title: Community Smell Detection and Refactoring in SLACK: The CADOCS Project
publications.authors: G. Voria, V, Pentangelo, A. Della Porta, S. Lambiase, G. Catolino, F. Palomba, F. Ferrucci
publications.journal: International Conference on Software Maintenance and Evolution (ICSME), 2022
